Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Superposition \Su`per*po*si"tion\, n. [Cf. F. superposition. See {Super-}, and {Position}.] The act of superposing, or the state of being superposed; as, the superposition of rocks; the superposition of one plane figure on another, in geometry. [1913 Webster]

superposition n 1: (geology) the deposition of one geological stratum on another 2: (geology) the principle that in a series of stratified sedimentary rocks the lowest stratum is the oldest [syn: {principle of superposition}, {superposition principle}] 3: (geometry) the placement of one object ideally in the position of another one in order to show that the two coincide 4: the placement of one thing on top of another
